column1: Campechuela is a municipality and town in Granma Province of Cuba. It is located on the southern shore of the Gulf of Guacanayabo.
The town of Campechuela was founded in 1869. It became the seat of the municipality in 1912.
The municipality is divided into the barrios of Cabecera (Campechuela town)

column2: the municipality of Campechuela had a population of 46
column3: 092. With a total area of 577 km2 (223 sq mi)
column4: it has a population density of 79.9/km2 (207/sq mi).

column1: The economy is based on agriculture (with sugarcane and fruit farms) and stock raising.
